subject: Async request to create PEL
commitMessage:
Async request to create PEL

To avoid any deadlocks between phosphor-logging and vpd-manager
service a wrapper around request to create PEL is created
which enables vpd-manager to make async requests to create PEL.

It also implements a new exception type to throw any GPIO
related exception. This was required to throw specific
exception.

Test:
Scenario 1:
While vpd-manager logs a pel with call out to an inventory
item.
It should be checked that both the services do not enter into
a deadlock situation.

Scenario 2:
Any third process is requesting to log PEL with call out
to an inventory item in a loop.
In the mean time vpd-manager also requests to log a PEL
with or without call out to inventory item.
All the pels should be logged correctly in the system.
No deadlock should appear.

Signed-off-by: Sunny Srivastava <sunnsr25@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I0efaf6918e679ca94808fc70d747c843a50eaf78

https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/46647/ : SUCCESS
this could be inside the executePreAction check
We are throwing from executePreAction api as well.
I am a bit confused on this change , as flow is altered. could have just made the current calls async only.

There was some limitations on making the calls async.
executePreAction and postfailActionis being called via both manager and vpd service as and when required.
Now to change the calls to async for all,  in place,  inside "preAction" and "PostFailAction", the main challenge was to keep sdBus in scope as without which no PEL was getting logged.
In case of ibm-vpd-read sdBus was going out of scope instantly after making the async call resulting in no PEL logged.
SO we needed a way to differentiate the caller and have sync and async call both here.
have a issue , should this be only for GIO based or generic ?
This is GPIO specific as we are only logging GPIO related PEL from manager, but yes we can make it generic, will be convenient for future.
what if additionalData  does not have description and passed.
Well, description is not a mandatory field and need not required while making sync call to createPEL.
This was hardcoded as only gpio pels are logged from manager and are made async but yes can have generic info like "Description is missing" if we make this api generic.
this make a change to the flow of where it is called from.

Well, be the return true or false in case of no pel logged, we are not altering that flow. Its just that if there was a PEL logged earlier we are making it throw an exception instead of logging pel and returning false.
So it will not alter the flow where only false was being returned.
you can remove either one of the executes
One is name of the function.
Yeah I know that. my point is user doesn't really care about the function name in an error log. "Executing executePostFailAction " doesn't sound exact to a layperson.

Well, maybe, but these are part of previous implementation and I am not comfortable changing code in the areas which does not related to this commit. 
You are seeing this as a change just because I have added try catch around which shifts them one tab right else the code remain the same.

Still if you want me that change in this commit let you can reply we can take a call.

why are we throwing again(from executePreAction() )  
and creating PEL here (moved out of executePreAction())?

Because I see we are handling all the exceptions inside pre and post action execution, now by moving it outside, every caller has to handle it.
SO any specific reason for that?

Yes the reason is this complete commit itself. 😊
We need to make sync or asyn PEL to phosphor-logging based on the caller to avoid the deadlock, which can only be done by the caller as it knows which way the PEL needs to be logged. 
So we need some signalling in caller to trigger logging PEL.
Do the additional data has only DESCRIPTION field? or Whether you avoid printing other fields?

As already mentioned in the description for this api, in case of async call only "DESCRIPTION" field will be supported.
Reason, sd_bus_call_method_async is a "variadic function" and deciding the number of parameters is not possible at runtime. Hence it has been limited to description only.
Don't we need to log PEL severity in the PEL created using async calls?
can you add more information like - the GPIO pin name and the pin value.

Not changing the code unless it is required by this commit.
Though those informations are already being added inside catch.

I understand the wrapper code to handle sync and async method call, but
by changing it from runtime to special type of exceptions, then throwing it outside and logging PEL there. I didn't understand why we are doing this. Please explain.

Inside "preAction" api, defined in ibm_vpd_app, in case of any other exception we don't want to log a PEL. PEL should be logged only if there is a GPIO related issue. Hence catching very specific exception.

See the same api in downstream code where we are throwing another exception from "preAction" api. So we want those exceptions to bypass pel route.

"in case of any other exception " - I see gpio related exceptions are getting handled as part of pre/post. and I don't see anything else in preACtion(), please point me to that.

And "PEL should be logged only if there is a GPIO related issue."- Im still not clear how moving createPEL outside is helping here. Let's take a call

I got it now. we moved createPEL for gpio out from utility to the caller, to indicate which service is logging that pel(vpd-parser or vpd-manager).

code looks ok to me.
Don't want to mention fru Details like inventoryPath?
can you print for which FRU the execution has failed?
can you add a brief for this class
Why not just call createPel with the nullptr passed in for sdbus here? That will keep the call sites consistent.
Why did you change the exception type here?
Now that we have a specific exception for GPIO, changes it for consistency across all the GPIO related exception being thrown.

we are not  covering "all the GPIO related exception being thrown" with this.
Other than find_line, all the gpio line request will also throw error(system_error) and (exception e ) can catch both of them(runtime_error and system_error).

like Line 770 -   presenceLine.request({"Read the presence line",
 gpiod::line_request::DIRECTION_INPUT, 0});
Nit: double spaces between call and will
Shouldn't this also come from the input severity parameter?
Shouldn't this also come from the input severity parameter?
